uh how to prevent cyclical flags so you
might have a personalized homepage
feature that depends on product rex and
product rex depends on dynamic promos
dynamic promos then uh relies on
personalized homepage and by doing that
you've introduced a cyclical flag and
depending on how your SDK handles this
you could be in an infinite loop or
something bad's probably going to happen
so the way that we uh check for this and
prevent it uh in growthbook is by uh
using a depth first search algorithm and
so I have a simplified version of the
code here um but basically we go through
the flag uh we have the flag and then we
have uh a map of all the flags with
their dependencies and we visit each of
the paths of those dependencies one by
one and basically if we come across on
that path the same flag that we've
already visited or seen then we know
that a cycle's been detected and we show
that to the user let them know this also
allows us to not allow users to uh
delete flags that depend on other flags
so um if there's time I could show a

stale so if it's not been updated in two
weeks it has no active environments it
has one-sided rules and basically that
means it always returns true it always
returns the same value this could also
means maybe it has no rules associated
with it it's not marked never stale by
the user it has no draft revisions all
rollout rules are 100% coverage and has

edge comes in so this is how our edge
SDK works we
um basically bring in uh so the client
there in the top left or yeah
um pings the edge the edge fetches the
page from the origin and then instead of
uh giving back you know the default kind
of state of things everything is
rendered right on the edge and the
client then gets back the uh fully
rendered page so there's no visual
flicker and then there's a much better
fidelity of data because the tracking
can happen on the edge and not in the
client and what this means is that then
for especially for AB testing for
finding out which features are
performing better you're going to have
much uh cleaner results and in our um
testing we found that when we used a
browser only client side uh uh feature
flagging that to the time to variant was
about 390 milliseconds there was that
flicker that I talked about and when we
switched to the edge it was only 150
milliseconds so it was about two to
three times faster which was pretty

that's uh that is compatible with um uh
